text.0: slight us not varuṇa aryaman or mitra Ṛbhukṣan indra Āyu or the maruts.
text.1: when we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the strong steed goddescended.
text.2: what time they bear before the courser covered with trappings and with wealth the grasped oblation.
text.3: the dappled goat goeth straightforward bleating to the place dear to indra and to pūṣan.
text.4: dear to all gods this goat the share of pūṣan is first led forward with the vigorous courser.
text.5: while tvaṣṭar sends him forward with the charger acceptable for sacrifice to glory.
text.6: when thrice the men lead round the steed in order who goeth to the gods as meet oblation.
text.7: the goat precedeth him the share of pūṣan and to the gods the sacrifice announceth.
text.8: invoker ministering priest atoner firekindler somapresser sage reciter.
text.9: with this well ordered sacrifice well finished do ye fill full the channels of the rivers.
text.10: the hewers of the post and those who carry it and those who carve the knob to deck the horses stake.
text.11: those who prepare the cookingvessels for the steedmay the approving help of these promote our work.
text.12: forth for the regions of the gods the charger with his smooth back is come my prayer attends him.
text.13: in him rejoice the singers and the sages a good friend have we won for the gods banquet.
text.14: may the fleet coursers halter and his heelropes the headstall and the girths and cords about him.
text.15: and the grass put within his mouth to bait himamong the gods too let all these be with thee.
text.16: what part of the steeds flesh the fly hath eaten or is left sticking to the post or hatchet.
text.17: or to the slayers hands and nails adherethamong the gods too may all this be with thee.
text.18: food undigested steaming from his belly and any odour of raw flesh remaining.
text.19: this let the immolators set in order and dress the sacrifice with perfect cooking.
text.20: what from thy body which with fire is roasted when thou art set upon the spit distilleth.
text.21: let not that lie on earth or grass neglected but to the longing gods let all be offered.
text.22: they who observing that the horse is ready call out and say the smell is good remove it.
text.23: and craving meat await the distributionmay their approving help promote labour.
text.24: the trialfork of the fleshcooking caldron the vessels out of which the broth is sprinkled.
text.25: the warmingpots the covers of the dishes hooks carvingboardsall these attend the charger.
text.26: the startingplace his place of rest and rolling the ropes wherewith the chargers feet were fastened.
text.27: the water that he drank the food he tastedamong the gods too may all these attend thee.
text.28: let not the fire smokescented make thee crackle nor glowing caldron smell and break to pieces.
text.29: offered beloved approved and consecratedsuch charger do the gods accept with favour.
text.30: the robe they spread upon the horse to clothe him the upper covering and the golden trappings.
text.31: the halters which restrain the steed the heelropesall these as grateful to the gods they offer.
text.32: if one when seated with excessive urging hath with his heel or with his whip distressed thee.
text.33: all these thy woes as with the oblations ladle at sacrifices with my prayer i banish.
text.34: the fourandthirty ribs of the swift charger kin to the gods the slayers hatchet pierces.
text.35: cut ye with skill so that the parts be flawless and piece by piece declaring them dissect them.
text.36: of tvaṣṭars charger there is one dissectorthis is the customtwo there are who guide him.
text.37: such of his limbs as i divide in order these amid the balls in fire i offer.
text.38: let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest let not the hatchet linger in thy body.
text.39: let not a greedy clumsy immolator missing the joints mangle thy limbs unduly.
text.40: no here thou diest not thou art not injured by easy paths unto the gods thou goest.
text.41: both bays both spotted mares are now thy fellows and to the asss pole is yoked the charger.
text.42: may this steed bring us allsustaining riches wealth in good kine good horses manly offspring.
text.43: freedom from sin may aditi vouchsafe us the steed with our oblations gain us lordship.
